posts.title: Mysteries of London
posts.excerpt: Quote: After her father is falsely jailed for embezzlement and her mother dies of grief, Louise is adopted by a kindly stockbroker. 15 years later, she falls in love with his dissolute son Frank, a mistake that nearly proves fatal to her. The film’s main historical point of interest, though, lies in the still highly …

posts.title: Shit Year
posts.excerpt: A renowned actress (Ellen Barkin) abandons her successful career for a secluded life in the hills. But before long, she begins to fear she has only lived through the characters she has played. Reality becomes inseparable from unhinged obsessions in a hallucinatory struggle to reclaim herself. With a tour de force by Barkin, Cam Archer’s …

posts.title: Verónica
posts.excerpt: Quote: Madrid, 1991. A teen girl finds herself besieged by an evil supernatural force after she played Ouija with two classmates.

posts._title: Hsiao-Hsien Hou – Nie yin niang AKA The Assassin (2015)
posts.title: Nie yin niang
posts.excerpt: An assassin accepts a dangerous mission to kill a political leader in seventh-century China. J. Hoberman wrote: “The Assassin” is extraordinarily beautiful. The film’s editing and narrative construction are, however, no less remarkable. For all its exquisitely furnished interiors and fantastic landscapes, “The Assassin” is far too eccentric to ever seem picturesque. Nor does it …

posts._title: Jean-Luc Godard – Soigne ta droite AKA Keep Your Right Up (1987)
posts.title: Soigne ta droite
posts.excerpt: Quote: Jean-Luc Godard wrote, directed, and edited this mind-boggling comedy. “The Idiot” (also known as “the Prince” and played by Godard himself) has been guaranteed financing for a film, if he can deliver it within 24 hours. But he encounters all sorts of hilarious problems as he attempts to do so. Meanwhile a pop group …

posts.title: The Ring
posts.excerpt: A 1927 British silent sports film directed and written by Alfred Hitchcock and starring Carl Brisson, Lillian Hall-Davis and Ian Hunter. It is one of Hitchcock’s nine surviving silent films. The Ring is Hitchcock’s only original screenplay although he worked extensively alongside other writers throughout his career.

posts.title: Ava
posts.excerpt: Synopsis A young woman finds out she is condemned to gradually lose her sight while spending her summer vacation at a beach resort. While her mother Maud has vowed to make Ava’s month of holidays an unforgettable experience, Ava decides to take a another route.

posts._title: Constantin Wulff – Ulrich Seidl und die bösen Buben AKA Ulrich Seidl: A Director at Work (2014)
posts.title: Ulrich Seidl und die bösen Buben
posts.excerpt: Quote: The film portrait Ulrich Seidl – A Director at Work depicts the controversial Austrian filmmaker Ulrich Seidl at work for the first time, painting a vivid picture of the much-debated “Seidl method”.
posts.titleEnglish: Ulrich Seidl: A Director at Work

posts.title: Amsterdam Global Village + Amsterdam afterbeat
posts.excerpt: From an interview about this film, conducted by Serge Toubiana, Is Amsterdam Global Village intended to be the portrait of a city? Can one in fact portray a city? – I don’t think you can portray anything, but you can build a city through film, using both fictional and direct cinema techniques, which I purposely …

posts._title: Jean-Luc Godard – Grandeur et décadence d’un petit commerce de cinéma (1986)
posts.title: Grandeur et décadence d’un petit commerce de cinéma
posts.excerpt: Quote: The director Gaspard Bazin is preparing a new feature film. For now, he is still in the casting and financing stages. He’s asking the help of Jean Almereyda, a producer once fashionable but now at low ebb, who has more and more difficulties to raise cash for his company. His wife, Eurydice, dreams of …
